showerReviews.reviewText: Sauna and steam room are good but unfortunately no cold plunge to be found. The main pool standard but it is extremely busy and more often than not half of it is booked for swimming clubs during peak times. The changing rooms and showers sometimes smell quite bad. Staff have also ignored concerns about the slippery floor in the spa despite the fact that people slip and hurt themselves regularly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great spot for some fitness swimming.
Fantastic, sympathetic restoration & expansion of the complex.
Good wee coffee shop on site too. Great cuppa!
The Heritage element is worth a visit on its own. Some very interesting exhibits.
Highly recommended.

Have invited several friends along who have been equally impressed with Templemore Baths.
showerReviews.author: David Kelso

showerReviews.reviewText:
Templemore Baths Leisure Centre is a fantastic facility that offers an exceptional blend of historical charm and modern amenities. The moment you step inside, you are greeted by the beautifully restored Victorian architecture that gives the place a unique and inviting atmosphere. It's evident that great care has been taken to preserve the heritage of the building while integrating state-of-the-art facilities.

The swimming pools are immaculate and cater to all ages and abilities, making it a great spot for families, serious swimmers, and those just looking to relax. The water is always at the perfect temperature, and the pool area is well-maintained and clean.

The gym at Templemore Baths Leisure Centre is equally impressive. It's equipped with a wide range of modern equipment, and the layout is spacious and conducive to a great workout. The fitness classes on offer are diverse and led by enthusiastic and professional instructors who make every session enjoyable and effective.

The wellness facilities, including the sauna and steam rooms, are top-notch. They provide the perfect place to unwind and rejuvenate after a workout or swim. The staff throughout the centre are friendly, helpful, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure visitors have a great experience.

Overall, Templemore Baths Leisure Centre is a standout facility that combines the best of both worlds ‚Äì historical elegance and contemporary convenience. Whether you're looking to swim, work out, or simply relax, this leisure centre has something for everyone. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: THX 2208

showerReviews.reviewText: Yesterday evening I saw the BBC If Walls Could Talk documentary on Templemore Avenue Baths. It looked good getting the investment to update it and see it being used. It brought back bad memories of attending it when I went to Templemore Avenue Primary School across the road. Mr Stanford was the Headmaster then, and once a week we walked over to swim. The chlorine smell from it was pungent. Building looked intimidating and we all dreaded Mr Kirkwood, the resident swimming instructor. He was frightening, green baggy tracksuit, Bobby Charlton comb over and whistle round his neck. He shouted at and bullied us kids. Getting changed in horrible cubicles by the pool was dismal. Your skin stank of chlorine. Then you were rushed to get out and dry. We were walking on the backs of shoe heels to get out. The television program gave some folk a voice, so this is my chance. They had the cherub fountain displayed all clean. I remember it a hideous thing covered in moss full of weeds. As a warning of the swimming session to come. They wouldn't get away with it today. My opinion, yours may be different. David Allen. ( Manchester).
showerReviews.author: Maggie Allen

locations.title: Olympia Leisure Centre and Spa
locations.address: ÓÉàBoucher Rd, Belfast BT12 6HR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Attended regular swimming sessions over the summer, but recently been completely put off for 2 reasons and will not go back. Mainly since schools started, they OVERCROWD the SWIM FOR ALL sessions in the afternoon where all lanes are taken away for school lessons and anyone that booked SWIM FOR ALL (today there was 25 of us) were crammed into the side, which was made even smaller at 6.15pm. This is not realistic or enjoyable because that section is used by kids and adults with babies so you can't swim in a lane one by one like you do when the FAST OR SLOW lanes are open, rather you try to avoid being kicked. SO, the staff should leave at least one sectioned off SLOW LANE for people that want to swim. I was in a group of 4, as there was no space to swim, we left after 20mins and we wanted a refund, which was not given so I feel robbed to be honest as its not fair to pay nearly 20 quid for 20mins.

The manager on duty 'Martin' was completely disrespectful, condescending, repetitive and UNPROFESSIONAL. He accused me of being disrespectful from begining after we had to wait 15mins for him because he was extremely 'busy' talking to colleagues, and the man at the reception who was very friendly and helpful but couldn't help with a refund, kept saying go over to the door to the pool (restricted for staff only) and get Martin. So I tried getting Martin, and basically got told in a rude manner to wait as he's extremely busy and he'll get to us when he's got time. He then refused to listen to the problem (as just explained above) and provide an acceptable solution, rather kept repeating several times how I booked the wrong session and I should book the Fitness session and how this is normal (getting bashed in the face by others and going to a swimming pool to not swim), which I explained is not right for several reasons. Additionally the times that fitness sessions are offered are ridiculous, either really early or late in the day.

So will try one of the other Swimming pools in Belfast or surrounding areas, and Olympia really needs to get better management....
showerReviews.author: Dominika Lyness

showerReviews.reviewText:
Tried yoga here was absolutely fantastic instructor was brilliant giving variations of beginners and intermediate for each pose, very peaceful is on the top floor. Part of my all inclusive Gll better membership cant wait to avail of what else is on offer. Next stop spa experience! üëç

Having spent few hours over two days to make a booking for the spa, partly due to my phone being broke, was told to come the following day around 2.30! So the girl explained a few things again registered me on the computer in the spa department now 3pm told me then to come come back at 3.45 so sat in my car till then left my two towels, went to spa, my towel was drenched, when I went to get showered asked the girl for another one, No unfortunately we can only give one! I had two with me and left them at my car as the girl stated we provide towels flip flops, would advise to bring your own towels even better a dressing gown in the towel material be handy. Steam room was out of use, ice room is a bowl of ice only, the showers and changing room is about the size of a disabled toilet! In there you have lockers on one side seating on the other & 3 showers were you must keep hitting the button for water as it goes off about every 5-6 seconds no shampoo or conditioner in either. The decor is beautiful, spa I dont know experience yes, definitely one I'm now thankful is now behind me. Cancelling my membership was another story, told I couldn't  cancel until I played the ¬£3 no show fee for a class I did not book. Between the spa receptionist and call handler hospitality at its worst!!! üëéüëéüëéüëéüëéI have worked in hospitality for twenty years, making life more difficult for a person does not come into it anywhere! I would suggest staff be trained in hospitality they will learn alot. It's all about making things as straightforward for the individual availing of your services
I hope everyone who attends this place of business has a better experience than I did.
showerReviews.author: seanene browne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited the spa at the end of March having visited before and had a good experience. This time there was a delay accessing the facilities due to software issues, parts of the spa area weren't working or closed completely, female showers weren't working so we'd to trudge across to the village changing with all the school kids.
I raised this as a complaint with the company that runs the spa who said they forwarded it to Olympia to deal with. Never heard so much as am acknowledgement. Unlikely to book again and definitely wouldn't recommend mostly due to how it has (or hasn't to be more precise) been handled.
Edit: leisure centre manager has been in contact and kindly apologised for the delay in contact and has offered complimentary passes as redress. Thanks
showerReviews.author: Lorraine Cairns

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a shame. I love Olympia and the classes it offers, but the swimming pool, particularly the changing rooms and toilets, have been really gross the last couple of times I brought my child to their swimming lesson. We recently had to switch from Brook - which is lovely, clean and warm. And now the difference at Olympia is so apparent. Changing rooms are dirty and often cold. Toilets with standing water so that feet get wet even with flip flops on. It all seems a bit neglected.

Great gym and swimming pool. The staff are an absolute dream! BUT the classes I want to take are either at 7am or 7pm which isn't very varied. Like most gyms the equipment is targeted towards men, which is a bit ridiculous in 2022.
Also the shower streams in the women's changing rooms are terrible, the actual shower part where the water jets out in a big cluster burning the living daylights out of whichever body part is unfortunate enough to be close to it. Good thing is my hair gets washed in two seconds flat, bad part...second degree burns. I know women like a nice hot shower but flowing lava is a bit much.

showerReviews.reviewText: Having visited many council run pools in Northern Ireland, this is one of my favourites.   Nice clean pool with separate lanes for length swimmers.  Friendly staff who were very happy to answer any questions. Why four stars only? The changing rooms are unisex and the parking is non existent. I pulled up on to the kerb and throughout the swim,. I was stressed as to whether I would get a parking ticket or not, throughout my swim. I didn't, but probably because it was after 6pm and the traffic wardens would have gone home!

showerReviews.reviewText: I visited Anderstown Leisure centre yesterday with my 7 and 9yr. We had a fantastic family day out. showerReviews.reviewText:
Lisnasharragh Leisure Centre in Belfast is an outstanding facility that truly caters to the diverse needs of the community. From the moment you walk through the doors, you are greeted by friendly and helpful staff who are always willing to go the extra mile to ensure your visit is enjoyable.

The centre boasts a wide range of modern amenities, including a state-of-the-art gym equipped with the latest fitness technology. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or just starting your fitness journey, there's something for everyone. The swimming pool is immaculate and well-maintained, providing a perfect environment for both casual swimmers and those training for competitions.

One of the highlights of Lisnasharragh Leisure Centre is its comprehensive schedule of fitness classes. With options ranging from high-intensity interval training to relaxing yoga sessions, the classes are led by knowledgeable and motivating instructors who make working out both fun and effective.

For families, the centre is a fantastic choice, offering a variety of activities for children of all ages. The dedicated children's play area and swimming lessons are particularly popular, ensuring that kids can stay active and entertained in a safe environment.

The facility is always clean and well-organized, and the recent renovations have only enhanced its appeal. The commitment to maintaining high standards of hygiene and customer service is evident throughout.

Overall, Lisnasharragh Leisure Centre is a gem in Belfast, providing excellent value for money and a welcoming atmosphere for all visitors. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to improve their fitness, enjoy some recreational activities, or simply spend quality time with family and friends.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Shankill Leisure Centre, nestled in the heart of Belfast, is a welcoming and modern facility that offers a range of amenities for individuals and families seeking to maintain an active and healthy lifestyle.

One of the standout features of this leisure center is its commitment to providing a well-rounded experience. The state-of-the-art gym is equipped with a variety of exercise machines and free weights, catering to fitness enthusiasts of all levels. The fitness classes and expert trainers add value to the fitness offerings, making it an excellent place to work on your health and wellness.

The swimming facilities at Shankill Leisure Centre are also noteworthy. The clean and well-maintained pools, complete with modern changing rooms, offer a refreshing escape for those looking to swim laps, engage in aquatic fitness classes, or simply enjoy some family fun in the water.

The center's family-friendly approach extends to the children's play areas and sports courts, providing options for kids and adults alike. The on-site caf√© offers a convenient spot to refuel after a workout or spend time with friends and family.

The staff at Shankill Leisure Centre are known for their friendly and helpful demeanor. They create a welcoming atmosphere, providing guidance and assistance to ensure visitors have a positive experience.

The leisure center's modern and well-kept facilities, coupled with its focus on community health and wellness, make it a valuable resource for the residents of Belfast. It's a place where people of all ages and fitness levels can come together to pursue an active and healthy lifestyle. Whether you're a dedicated gym-goer, a swimmer, or a family looking for fun activities, Shankill Leisure Centre has something to offer.

showerReviews.reviewText: Hello, I purchased my membership on February 15th, and I am not happy with the rude manner of the pool officials, swing for fitness, there is no instructor, the admissions staff have no idea about the classes, there are no swimming classes for adults, nor do they know where these classes are taught, I usually go with my nephew who is in water polo classes and in a very rude way they yell at the child and do not let him practice, I find myself in the position of arguing and asserting the rights of the child, yesterday Sunday we attended as a family and they yelled at me rudely since I was giving the key to the locker room to my relative, I am exercising on medical recommendation, and I needed a board to be able to exercise in the pool, thus fulfilling my rehabilitation, I know they have them and they denied them to me, already today February 27, we went to train and the staff prohibited us from entering, without any kind of explanation, then my membership is lost money, I paid to go to a serious center and now if during operating hours and without prior notice I will be denied the membership. Admission without prior notice and explanations, I feel unhappy and scammed, it seems shameful to me, and the lack of education and seriousness of such a shameful center should be taken to social networks, I had to buy a board to be able to exercise, and the center denied them to me.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent , but often busy gym, with a good coffee shop

Classes are good and well run, and the staff are great. Facilities are clean and the environment is good. Parking is easy and free for up to 3hrs.

Pool hours on Saturdays are limited to 1-5pm for lane swimming (open for family swim, more like a leisure centre pool), which is not good value for money if you're paying for peak times membership.

In the gym, people often sit idly looking at their phones on the weight machines, making it difficult to get on, and the staff make no effort to discuss this or provide signage encouraging good etiquette.

Climbing wall is unavailable for booking up on Saturdays, and Mon, Wed, and Fri evenings.

locations.address: ÓÉàCrannog House, 44-48 Stranmillis Embankment, Belfast BT9 5FL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined this gym at around 3pm on a Saturday because I specifically wanted to start training that same day. However, it was not made clear during the sign up process that if you join outside staffed hours, you cannot access the gym until someone is there to give you access. That would have been fine if it had been clearly stated, but it was not. I paid ¬£63 to join and then discovered I could not use the gym at all, which was very disappointing.

When I emailed to raise the issue, I received a phone call from a staff member (possibly the manager). The way he spoke to me was extremely unprofessional. He was super aggressive, defensive, dismissive, and offered no apology and just told me I was wrong even though I was sitting looking at the sign up info. The call was hostile and not at all helpful. I‚Äôm not actually sure why he called me to be honest. It just seemed like he wanted to have a go at someone rather than actually help in any way, it was a total waste of time. Had I been able to cancel immediately after that call and not been tied down for a year, I would not have continued with the membership. I was really shocked at how he spoke to me.

The gym itself was okay. Most of the lockers upstairs did not work the entire year I was a member. The hand dryers in the bathrooms are really bad and unlike other (cheaper) gyms I have been to, some common machines for training were not there.

When I later emailed to enquire about cancelling at the end of my contract, the responses I received from Mark were blunt, unhelpful, and unclear. After cancellation, my access was cut off earlier than it should have been. I was told my final access day would be the 30th, but it was cut off on the 29th, and I had already paid for access into the following month until 2nd December inclusive. I emailed to question this and request a refund for the days owed or have the days added on, but never received a reply.

Aside from this, every other staff member I interacted with in person was friendly and helpful.

Overall, I would not return. There are better gyms nearby for the same or lower price with better communication, better equipment availability, and much better customer service.
showerReviews.author: Peter

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love the outdoor pool, the only one in Belfast, open all year round. Unfortunately it‚Äôs quite dirty, visible sand and dirt in pockets all along the bottom of the pool and in the corners. When the pool is busy, the gravel is disturbed and floats around in the water. I was assured the pool is vacuumed daily, but I‚Äôve been swimming since October and it‚Äôs getting worse.
I was also hit in the back by a tennis ball while swimming in the outdoor pool - so be careful. They assured me that the adjacent tennis court nets met their risk assessments so no action was taken. Really expected more from David Lloyd.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôd echoe some of the previous reviews.
Multiple membership promotions annually, obsessed with hyrox to the detriment of other members, there‚Äôs loads of issues.

The showers are always cold and spa equipment often out of order. The locker area is in dire need of a re-do and a lot of gym equipment sits for weeks or months without being fixed or replaced.

The car park is a minefield with the potholes and dodging hyroxers jumping in front of your car.

This gym has a great location and fantastic facilities beside it, but can‚Äôt help feeling I and other members are taken for granted.

Fix the things that need fixing as opposed to constantly chasing new members.

April update: another membership promotion, car park still a disgrace and changing rooms no better‚Ä¶.

August update : you never post your bank holiday opening hours on social media beforehand..

December update: potholes never fixed in car park is indicative of the owners attitude to this place. Shower area is an absolute disgrace now , arguably a bio hazard
showerReviews.author: S

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good gym but very very tired changing rooms and toilets. Needs a few quid spent on floor and showers fixed to work correctly. Would be nice if the sauna was a little bigger and steam room smaller as I often need to wait to use sauna

(Members sit shaving in the steam room/ sauna and when I confronted him said that he has permission from the owner so I guess it‚Äôs one set of rules of some and different for others unfortunately)

Things that would be nice in the gym

-pay as you go ice bath would be fantastic!

-Would be nice to have hot & ice cold towels available to use at a small fee or complimentary

-it would be nice to switch to a 24hr gym similar to other commercial gyms

-it would be nice if more health facilities could be added such as ice bath / red light therapy/ oxygen therapy more membership options would be nice to help with added costs for more health facilities and also would be nice if the sun bed was removed as this is the opposite of what a gym is supposed to be about.

locations.title: Better Gym Connswater
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 11, Connswater Retail Park, Belfast BT5 4AF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I love this gym.  I hadn't been to a gym in over 20 years and took the plunge last August to get in shape.  I was very conscious about my size and lack of fitness knowledge, but needn't be as the staff there were fantastic and made me feel at ease.   Nikki took me through the gym equipment in detail... she was brilliant and professional. The staff are always friendly and they have time for you if you have any queries on gym equipment.  I feel very safe here.  Also, the staff keep the gym very clean.  The gym is very large with a good selection of equipment. Free tea, coffee and water available. There is an excellent selection of fitness classes held upstairs in the studio...... spin classes held downstairs. The website lists the classes available. Very large and and clean changing rooms with showers, lockers (hairdryers in ladies changing rooms). In addition, a large car park just outside in the main retail park.    Great gym, great staff.
showerReviews.author: Dr.

locations.title: Let's Go Hydro
locations.address: ÓÉàKnockbracken Reservoir, 1 Mealough Rd, Carryduff, Belfast BT8 8GB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!

When we arrived and entered the check in reception area all four members of staff turned and blankly stared at us. We weren't greeted with a hello or even a smile. When I told them my name and that we were here to check in one of the girls simply said follow me and got into a van and drove off. It was a very strange experience.

When we got to the accommodation, the girl handed us the key and left. She did not explain how to work the hot tub or how to turn on the heating for the accommodation.

The carpet in the room had dirt, stones and twigs on it like it hadn't been hoovered before our arrival. The towels provided had orange and black stains on them. The bed had hairs in it.

When we went to use the hot tub the first evening, the lid of the hot tub was rotting away and had huge holes so there were leaves, twigs, bugs, and other debris floating around in the murky water. It was disgusting. Not to mention that the water was lukewarm despite the outside heating button being on since we had arrived.

That night we couldn't figure out how to work the heating as we were not told and there were no instructions or guides available within the accommodation. It was absolutely freezing all night; we had to sleep with joggers and hoodies over our pyjamas.

When we went to the spa, the hot tubs were not even lukewarm in temperature, they were genuinely cold. We could not even sit in one of them for more than 30 seconds. I had even asked the woman at the spa reception were the hot tubs turned on because I couldn't believe how cold they were. She informed me that was just the temperature that they always were. Which is strange as a hot tub should be hot. This was such a disappointment. We had to spend the entire hour and a half in the sauna, taking breaks by walking up and down the path. We were extremely let down.

I spent a total of ¬£460 for this weekend trip which is a complete waste of money. We could have gone to the Galgorm for an overnight stay and a visit to the spa village for less than that and we would have had an amazing time.
showerReviews.author: Jade McShane

locations.title: Peterborough Lido Outdoor Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàSt Peters House, Lido, Bishop's Rd, Peterborough PE1 1YY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a fantastic place! It's so nice to have a traditional building that sparks memories of days gone by.

The main pool is huge, with plenty of space to swim, play catch or use inflatables.

There are lockers there with a refundable ¬£1 charge.

There are toilets, benches and a cafe there, that serves chips and burgers, sandwiches, drinks and cakes. The prices are reasonable as well. They sell ice lollies as well.

We sat on the grassy area with a picnic blanket. There is a small play area for kids with a climbing frame,  slide and swing.

Plenty of space to find a spot to sit.
The water in the pool was a good temperature.
showerReviews.author: Karen; Finding Fifty

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice building and lovelly pool.  A real asset for the people of Peterborough who need to do everything possible to make sure that this facility is kept operational.
Very traditional feel with some nice music in the background, well organised swimming lanes, and plenty of changing and toilet facilities available.
Changing and toilet facilities are male and female at either end of the complex.
There is a cafe and several outdoor areas to eat, with food and drinks available, although I'm not sure what time the cafe opens!

showerReviews.reviewText: This pool is an absolute stunner! There is plenty of paid parking nearby and a short walk through the gardens - you can't miss the lido with its clock tower. Entry through traditional turnstiles into a mosaic lobby and the wonderful 1930s buildings surrounding the pool. Changing cubicles are modern, toilets are clean, but there are only a few showers. Lockers available (¬£1 refundable). There are 3 pools on site - 50m main pool, a learner pool, and a paddling pool. The main pool was heated to around 24¬∞ when we visited and was clean and well maintained with attentive lifeguards, with jolly music to listen to while you swim. There is a cafe on site, and worth having a post-swim hot drink on the first floor terraces which have stunning views of the pool and surrounding gardens. Loved it - will definitely be back ü´∂
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice day out with the kids.
We tried to go in a day before but as the weather was really hot but they were fully booked and were not letting people in anymore. We booked an afternoon session for the next day and it was lovely. It was easy to book online and to get in the next day.
Lots of lifeguards around. Staff are nice and friendly.

Giving it a 4 star as the water was actually cold even though it was a hot day, we expected the pools to be heated but the kids kept complaining the water was cold, one of them didn‚Äôt even stay in the water. Luckily there is a play area that kept him entertained while the other two were swimming.
Also there were lots of cigarette butts left around in the grass area.

Overall it was a good day out. But I don‚Äôt think I would visit on days that the weather is not hot as we would probably be freezing cold.
showerReviews.author: Larissa Franca

showerReviews.reviewText: As the only public swimming venue in Peterborough then you have to make do, however that is really easy to do, but a morning, afternoon or all day ticket on line and off you go, changing rooms are modest in both senses of the word good lockers many seats around the pools to drape your towel, a grassed area for possible picnics, a toddlers pool, a little persons pool and a heated main pool. The main pool has lanes for those who want to knotch up lengths. Me and my lady swam carefree in the main pool but partook of lane swimming at the end. The cost for our 4 hour morning swim was ¬£7 each. Well worth it

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place. A very bad experience from start to finish. I took my children who were excited to spend a few hours there and we end up leaving in 15 minutes.

Very run down place and hygiene is not great. The pool is filled with trees leaves and ants.

They didn‚Äôt allow my 7 and halt year to go on the blue slide saying the rule is 8+ while most water parks around the world look the height as this safer and staff can verify. I saw other children who were much younger and when asked the staff they said we appreciate you didn‚Äôt lie like others. I didn‚Äôt come across any of these rules prior on the website which meant I wasted time and money going there.

It was around 14:30 and all the sudden they shut the doors to the slides with no notice displayed or anything explained.

Steer away. Not worth a penny. I would give it 0 star.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a huge outdoor, unheated pool. Sections of the pool, which is an irregular shape, are divided into  slides/splash area, an area for families, and a section for lane swimming. The outdoor pool is part of a leisure centre with indoor pool, but access to the outdoor pool is separate to the leisure centre and can be reached via the car park. Plenty of free parking. We went for an early morning lane swim - there were only 4 of us in the pool, so plenty of space and the local/regular swimmers made us feel really welcome (even giving us 'Friends of Aldershot Lido' swimming caps, which were a lovely souvenir of our visit). The laned section of the pool is about 25-30m & fairly deep. Pool is well maintained and lovely to see the traditional fountain in operation. Changing facilities are basic but clean & clean toilets and hot showers. Lockers available poolside, but bring padlock. Overall we really enjoyed our visit üòä
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

locations.title: JD Gyms Belfast
locations.address: ÓÉàHillview Retail Park, Crumlin Rd, Belfast BT14 7DU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
BEST GYM IN BELFAST BY A MILE!
This super-mega gym is easily the most equipped facility in the area. Firstly, it's massive and the pictures aren't lying - there's enough equipment here for everyone - even at peak times.

The first thing you'll notice is the ultra modern d√©cor, very much 'death star', but it kinda works.

The cardio area is massive and they even have an area specifically for training legs and glutes with the funky square lights (very popular with ladies).

The Eleiko functional and weightlifting areas have amazing kit and the weights area, whilst it looks tiny, actually spans half of the lower floor - but you'd never know because it's 'hidden' away from the more visible areas of the gym. I think they do this to keep the 'bodybuilder types' from intimidating other gym goers?

Upstairs, you'll find the class studio which hold many of it's classes (but no spin bikes or spin classes), and the changing rooms are cool too - both have saunas in them for post workout recovery.

It's open 24 hours a day 7 days a week and you get unlimited free parking too.

Have a look around if you're not sure about joining, but I guarantee you won't find a better deal than this place.
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

locations.title: Embankment Service Station
locations.address: ÓÉà287 Shore Rd, Belfast BT15 9PW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: It cost nothing to be nice to people. Used the car wash and the machine got stuck. I wasnt sure if to get out of the car so I phoned the staff and the girl on the phone said she will come soon. After a few minutes wait I went inside and same person said that I was told she will come and to move as she is serving other people, said that her colleague was on break. I asked for the refund as was in a rush but was told that isnt possible. When the fella came out he resumed the machine he put the shortest programme while I paid for the more advanced one. I asked for the refund of the difference after and again was refused as it 'came of my card' lol and I can come back tomorrow morning to speak to a manager. Really poor service; its not the first time of a poor experience on that station and I generally would avoid this place.
showerReviews.author: Magda Lobodzinska

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would leave 0 stars if I could. Not because of the ladies who work there but because of the man who owns the place. My family and I have shopped there for YEARS, well before he came along. When my sister who suffers with Asperger syndrome told him the car wash machine ate her ¬£1 he tried to put 2 10ps back in instead of 2 50ps, then laughed at her when she pointed out what he did. Then when I was in the garage a few hours later he stood at the window glaring at her to try and intimidate her while she stayed in her car. After witnessing this I phoned the garage , explained what I had witnessed and asked him not to do it again and he started screaming at me down the phone and hung up.
Some people really need retrained in their customer service, that man is 1 nasty piece of work !!
showerReviews.author: Ann Mcclure

showerReviews.reviewText:
NOT WORTH THE PRICE. I booked a private bedroom for a day of rest in-between travels, and boy am I glad it was only for one night. I didn't expect much it's only a room in a hostel, but still for ¬£70 I felt scammed. Basic cleanliness and comfort would have been nice.
The bed is old and rickety, with a hole behind it and no electric outlets anywhere near it. The sheets don't fit the mattress and don't feel clean or fresh.
The bathroom is something out of the 1960s in soviet union with a shower not separated by any kind of glass wall or curtain from the rest of the bathroom, spraying water everywhere. No bin in the bathroom: if you are on your period, good luck! The door of the bathroom is moldy were people hang their towel. Want to rinse your mouth after cleaning your teeth? Take a water bottle because the  pressure of the faucet is too much to cup water in your hands without waterboarding yourself.
There are holes in the ceiling of the bathroom, the plaster is coming of the walls everywhere, I'm pretty sure the floorboard beneath the window is moldy too, and why the hell are the switches so far away from the bed? Even the chairs and the tea/coffee station in the reception are look dodgy. It just adds up.
For ¬£40 it might be acceptable but clearly not for ¬£70.
showerReviews.author: Sam Aubert

locations.title: Holiday Inn Express Belfast City by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉà106 University St, Belfast BT7 1HP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location and a very convenient hotel for a short city break in Belfast.
The hotel is very close to the city centre ‚Äì it‚Äôs about a 10-minute walk to the Christmas Market and the main attractions. Just behind the hotel there is a street with plenty of restaurants, food spots and a few small shops, which makes it easy to find something to eat without going far.
A big plus is the free on-site parking for guests, which is not easy to find in this part of the city. The hotel also has a small gym, useful if you want to stay active during your trip.
The rooms are clean and well-equipped, perfect for a short stay. Everything you need is provided: towels, hairdryer, kettle with coffee, tea and milk. The room was comfortable and practical.
Breakfast is what you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express: croissants, bread, jam, chocolate spread, scrambled eggs, rashers, sausages, hash browns, tomatoes, cereals with milk, coffee, tea and orange juice. Nothing fancy, but absolutely fine and more than enough for a 1‚Äì2 night stay.
There is also a bar and a comfortable lounge area, nice for relaxing in the evening.
Overall, a very good choice for location, comfort and value for money. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Belfast.
showerReviews.author: Aneta jakos

Best of all is the decor and vibe of the place - hands down one of the coolest places I've stayed in. Every wall is covered in artwork, instruments, maps, messages from strangers. You name it. Would definitely stay again and for longer.
showerReviews.author: Ryan Barlow

showerReviews.reviewText: All staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. I was only staying 3 nights, it was very cheap, multiple shower and bathrooms. ||Main floor, reception, lounge where everyone can hang out, kitchen where there is a fridge you can put food in ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: The staff are some of the loveliest you‚Äôll meet and go above and beyond to welcome you. It‚Äôs a well-priced hostel, and we appreciated the free breakfast as part of the cost. However, it needs a serious upgrade. The feel of the rooms is ‚Äòschool camp style‚Äô. There is no privacy like you might get in a pod style with curtains - it‚Äôs all completely open. There are no shelves for you to place things near your bed. There are under-bed cages but they are not lockable. The lockers offered are too small for your average sized luggage and most were broken. There weren‚Äôt even any hooks anywhere to hang your (own) towel. After being in several hostels, it‚Äôs clear which ones are thoughtful about arranging spaces, and this one is not.
showerReviews.author: Nicole Torres

showerReviews.reviewText:
The worst hostel of my life!
I would have been better off sleeping outside‚Ä¶

Sleeping surrounded by cockroaches and homeless people, feeling the slats through the mattress, having a sore back for a week, and smelling cigarette smoke as soon as you enter‚Ä¶
The showers are moldy and often unusable, the neighborhood is dangerous and far from the city center, and you can feel unsafe at any moment.
The staff is completely unwelcoming.

An experience to avoid at all costs.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a touchless hotel.  Everything is done by internet, the front door is coded lock and the room keys are in lock boxes.  You are given the code before you arrive.

It was a very interesting stay having never completed a touch less stay.  The room was immaculately clean!  Towels were not luxurious but did the trick.  The room itself was a full size bed which comfortably fit my wife and I.  The room itself was in the smallish size, think bedroom in an older home.  The city noises kept my wife awake one night, lots of traffic, sirens, people walking the ally and all.  For me, it was white noise.  If you‚Äôre a sensitive to noise sleeper, you may want to weigh this heavily!

The location was great!  We were 20 minutes walking from pretty much everywhere we wanted to be.  25 minutes from Belfast Grand Central Station.

The breakfast was good!  Continental with fruit, yogurt, cereals, breads, butter jams etc.  You will be adequately fed for the day!

By no means is this hotel luxurious? But it is clean, fun and reasonably priced.  I rather enjoyed our stay!  We took a tour of the northern Irish coast and the pickup was very close so it worked well.  Cheers!!
showerReviews.author: Dan Kalm

locations.title: The Avenue Belfast
locations.address: ÓÉà88 Templemore Ave, Belfast BT5 4FW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
While the booking sites may promise a lot of things about this place, a quick little research showed that this is a self-serve bed and breakfast... with that in mind, they truly deserve 5 stars. Everything was clean and spotless. There are quite a few options in the self-serve kitchen and it is well stocked with pots, pans, cooking utensils, etc. incase you want to go to the local market and cook your own meals.
The hot water is on demand and plenty hot.
The owner of the place was kind and helpful as my original hotel canceled on me and I needed a place last minute. I ended up just staying here for my 4 days in Belfast because it was so nice.
If you are looking for huge rooms and around the clock service, this isn't for you... but if you are looking for a clean place to lay your head and grab a shower i couldn't recommend anywhere else.
showerReviews.author: Ryan Henry

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived and lasted like 20min before cancelling and then leaving. For starters the place is in a fare enough rough area, beside us there was this house with kid playing the flute as loud as he possibly could (Not the b&b fault but still incredibly annoying as is in the middle of a residential area) and our window facing straight. The bedroom was really tiny, the door kept banging it self on the door frame with the wind even when closed. The bathrooms are not onsuite so you are sharing, the showers are fully separated too so not a lot of privacy. Lots of noise coming from everywhere plus is very close to the airport and the planes are constantly passing over. Would not recommend at all!
showerReviews.author: Morrigan Elizabeth Doyne

showerReviews.reviewText: Owner was lovely and let us in early. However, we found our stay unpleasant. Unfortunately bed was incredibly uncomfortable with one side being significantly worse than the other, which is difficult when two people are sharing a bed. The window was left open to let air in however, it was near the smoking area and on numerous occasions we woke to the smell of cigarette smoke. We didn't realise the airport was near and noise was an issue. The set up of the accommodation is not sound proof and we could hear showers running, people going up and down stairs and conversions sometimes felt as if they were coming through the door which was a little unnerving. There was only one key to get into the building and it was just tough if someone else took it. Room was budget friendly and very basic if that's what your looking for. Communal area was good. Parking was free and the city centre is about a 20 minute walk.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer Moore

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am a local author and I just wanted a night away somewhere not too far so I booked a pod at CarrickReagh Bay.

I was so happy with the level of care that had gone into creating a safe space.

It was always warm in the pod and the privacy screening was also a really nice touch so that those outside could not see in.  It was so peaceful. The shower room was divine and a beautiful experience. I also loved how easy it was to pull down the bed.

The emails before and after were also a great support and I loved the convenience of it being self check in.

showerReviews.reviewText: Pros: Good location for ferry on main route, easy access and easy to find. Facilities were clean and showers were good with lots of hot water. Pitches were hardstanding. Cons: Main gate was open on arrival despite being issued with a pass code and strict instruction not to share the code? There is no security on site so I raised this with the cafe staff member who said gates would be closed when they left at 5pm as their cars were parked in there. Gates still left open after they left.  I called an emergency no at 7.30pm to advise same as I had read a previous review about Travellers previously arriving on site and the site being open to anyone was a concern. I was advised that someone would be contacted and they would come to check and close the gates. No one bothered to come to site, gates were open all night so no security at all. No point in issuing a barrier code if gates are not closed anyway other than to use showers/toilet so we could have just turned up without paying, parked up, used our own facilities and had a free night. Not great.
showerReviews.author: T B

showerReviews.reviewText: Pros: Good location for ferry on main route, easy access and easy to find. Facilities were clean and showers were good with lots of hot water. Pitches were hardstanding. Cons: Main gate was open on arrival despite being issued with a pass code and strict instruction not to share the code? There is no security on site so I raised this with the cafe staff member who said gates would be closed when they left at 5pm as their cars were parked in there. Gates still left open after they left.  I called an emergency no at 7.30pm to advise same as I had read a previous review about Travellers previously arriving on site and the site being open to anyone was a concern. I was advised that someone would be contacted and they would come to check and close the gates. No one bothered to come to site, gates were open all night so no security at all. No point in issuing a barrier code if gates are not closed anyway other than to use showers/toilet so we could have just turned up without paying, parked up, used our own facilities and had a free night. Not great.
showerReviews.author: T B

showerReviews.reviewText: Small caravan park, not the best view and if you are noise sensitive then you may notice the road noise. Good walks along the sea and you can go into Belfast easily by foot. Showers and toilet block, water and laundry facilities (extra) facility to empty own toilet. Showers the best I have had nice and powerful and hot!
showerReviews.author: Nina Pace

showerReviews.reviewText:
A really good park up for campervans and, motorhomes and caravans. It's next to the water in a locked gated section. Beautifully clean washing up area, toilets and shower, black waste disposal and laundry. It has a really good cafe just outside the gate and easy access into Belfast by bus and train.
You must book in advance as no reception, you get all the details of how to enter in your booking. 20 mins from the Belfast ferry terminal.

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice quiet spot, lovely view to lakes from camper van. ¬£30 for one night with electric and we arrived after 6pm and left  by 9am. Only 1 shower working in ladies loo, only one overhead light working. Small play area for kids. Nothing within walking distance to do so bare in mind you will have to drive if you want to do anything. When you drive in you may think it's a mistake as you literally drive into a farm yard, then goi drive up around some sheds up a narrow lane and you find the site with a lot of permanent mobile holiday homes. Only space for about 5 caravans or campers at most. Facilities were clean enough. Think it's more suited to people looking for a quiet rest and not to move about much, wouldn't really say it's for families.
showerReviews.author: Rose Finnerty

showerReviews.reviewText: Booking the spot was not entirely easy as the landlord is really not easy to understand, especially not at the phone. In the end we found the place behind an old farm and got a warm welcome by a really friendly dog. The site offers a nice view over a lake nearby. The facilities were basic, the toilets didn't flush properly, the showers (in the lady's only one worked) were cold in the evening, so better use them in daytimes ; -). For one night, it was ok, but nothing special. There is a playground for children, but one of the items looks seriously rust-eaten, not sure if that's entirely safe anymore.

locations.title: Castle Ward Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàCastle Ward Estate, Strangford, Downpatrick BT30 7LS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely camping site.  Friendly, helpful and welcoming staff. Stunning walks anytime of the day around Castle Ward woods and  part of Strangford Lough. Although no designated child play area, still plenty to discover around Castle Ward grounds for everyone who is interested in nature.
Plenty of space for a caravan and awning. Dog friendly,  clean toilets and showers.
For any one coming from over the sea and want to discover Northern Ireland and beyond,  camping Castle Ward is a good, cheap place to stay and start your journey. Plus as extra, free entrance to NT property all around Northern Ireland during your stay.
showerReviews.author: Ronald Jansen

showerReviews.reviewText: Castle ward is a beautiful caravan, camping spot on the shores of Strangford lough nestled with the national trust run castle ward estate. A beautiful location with very clean facilities. Better suited to families and dog lovers than couples looking for a quiet break. Great walking trails within the estate for those looking for nothing too strenuous.
showerReviews.author: kelly derges

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay at Castle Ward Caravan Park was excellent!

The campsite itself is fairly small, and in a stunning spot. Ringed by tall trees with the sea lough close by, and a short walk to Castle Ward proper. Lovely.

The facilities were plenty and kept very clean, with laundry, freezers, plugs and a washing up space in one block, and showers and toilets in the other.

The staff were really friendly; Elaine gave us some excellent recommendations for local attractions, and Erik was always on hand if we had any questions about the campsite.

We would highly recommend this campsite, and look forward to staying again some time in the future.

Also, thank you to the staff member (I didn't catch your name, sorry!) who put us up in one of the pods when the winds were getting a bit high for our little tent! A very kind gesture.
showerReviews.author: Max Popham

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Medium-sized caravan site which is an ideal place for families with children. The pitches are mostly situated in a circle surrounding the large grassed area where tents can be pitched and also provides a perfect place for children to gather and play games. We were on pitch number 16 and there was a well worn path into the woods right beside our van which the children made frequent use of.  It didn't bother us in the least but there was a wider and more popular access to the woods on the next pitch to ours. There were 4 toilets and 2 showers for women plus a unisex(?) accessible bathroom. The 2 showers were fine with plenty of hot water but go early to avoid having to wait. They were very clean but small. The campsite is just under a mile from Strangford village. There is a pavement all the way. There are at least 3 nice restaurants in Strangford plus a ferry to Portaferry every 30 mins. You can walk to Castle Ward itself in about 20 mins from the campsite.  It's a lovely building and well worth a visit. The whole estate is more than 800 acres so miles and miles of paths to explore.
showerReviews.author: Anna Kavanagh

The campsite is very well looked after.During the day the attendee is very helpful and a nice character. The surrounding area is beautiful and lots to explore. showerReviews.reviewText: Clean, quiet, good value site with a great on site pub. Pitches were a great size and we were able to get electric hook up for our tent. Bathroom facilities were excellent with very hot showers! Great to see the games room/inside area, would be great to take advantage of this in less favourable weather! Hosts Colin and his family were very friendly and happy to chat to us in the bar. We found Sperrin to be a good base to go out to other attractions in the area and very beautiful for driving and walking.

The entire site is clean - and well laid out, so everyone has space. (We were in a tent, in some previous sites it has felt like the tents are a little too close together). We were able to play pool in the games room and take our dog into the bar with us. There are also loads of dog walks only a short drive away - we went to Lough Fea which was a lovely walk. The Shepherds Rest pub outside seating area is really impressive too and I‚Äôd say is lovely on a sunny day! Price is great too. No phone signal on site - but it made our trip more enjoyable to get off our phones. Highly recommend - have recommended to friends and we will definitely be back again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I camped here in my tent the night before doing the Lap the Lough cycling event in nearby Moy. I opted for the electrical hookup for extra comfort. Phone signal was weak but present. Other reviews had me worried there would be no Internet, but there was.

This place is dog friendly,  which I liked,  although I didn't have a dog with me.

The common area was clean and even had a pool table. Showers etc were of a high standard. I didn't use the kitchen but it looked good.

I was warmly welcomed when I arrived. It was busy, but I still had a choice of pitches. More camper vans than tents.

Nice spot to bring your family. I slept like a baby. A +
showerReviews.author: Pat Folan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here overnight.
Campsite is clean and tidy, facilities are in good order, modern clean toilets and showers, a large lounge area and it is a lovely quite spot.
Maybe most outstanding were the staff.  We registered with the bar on arrival, having booked on line, the barman showed us to the facilities and was very welcoming.  Later we went in to the pub for a pint.  Guinness was excellent and over the course of the evening the barman came over for a bit of unobtrusive conversation about the area, places to visit, canoeing locations and then poetry.  We ended up leaving with a couple of books of poetry he insisted we took with us, to return whenever it suited the following morning.
We will be back.
showerReviews.author: John Wilkinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great spot for camping especially if you are intending on some star gazing. We managed to see the milky way during our stay. Close to OM Observatory and beaghmore stone circle, great base for exploring the area.
Clean toilets and showers, lots of bins for rubbish too. Great play park for kids and gate with a coded lock for getting in and out via car so felt safe too. Very cheap to stay and clear instructions on how to get in via email beforehand. Family friendly site with great forest to explore and excitedly for us Bats flying about while we made smores at night, amazing!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic place to camp if you have kids!
Stayed for 5 nights and it was so peaceful and relaxing! Kids loved having the park close by and the forest walks for little adventures.
The bathrooms could do with a deep clean (especially the ceiling), and the disabled bathroom has no spot for setting clothes on while you shower, but the facilities are generally good.
We will absolutely be back!
"Just amazing!"
"Has nice views of the forest when the sun is going down"
Edit: we've been back for a week for three years in a row. Absolutely fantastic spot
showerReviews.author: Cocktails Are Just Grown Up Juice

showerReviews.reviewText: Eerily quiet for early August. Cantina closed so got breakfast off site. Loads of midges around the cabins. Still a fun night's stay for the kids and a decent night's sleep. locations.title: Rosebank Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉà199 Whitechurch Rd, Ballywalter, Newtownards BT22 2LA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed here for a sunny week in May in our touring caravan. There are only 3 touring pitches on site.  The rest of the site is made up of static caravans. The one we were at had a gorgeous sea view and was only 10m from the edge of the beach, and had services at the pitch. The beach is sandy with rock pools and lots of seaweed and great for making sandcastles and walking. The toilets and showers are basic but fine. There is a laundry and sluice but no chemical toilet disposal. There is a good playpark and a football pitch. There is WiFi available at a charge, but also some data coverage in the area. The owners are friendly and helpful.
showerReviews.author: Deborah Simpson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clean and warm pool for the 1 out of 4 times I have tried to take my 1yr old. First time: went on a Sunday paid at the till got a band got into the pool
Second time: went on a Friday turned away and told they do lesson on a Friday until five o clock which at the time did not state on there website my friend was also with her one year old and advised for them to update
Third time: Turned away was told that it was too busy I asked did I need to book I was told no first come first served basis
Fourth time: Which was today told that the learner pool was fully booked and would have to wait 45 minutes for the next slot and that I should of booked I advised that I was previously told I didn‚Äôt, I asked to give me two minutes to check with my husband and when I went back to them I was told sorry the slots gone
I seriously recommend better communication to be told three different things it also doesn‚Äôt state on line advising for prior booking, and as every parent knows it‚Äôs not easy trying to get a one year old out of the house
Really disappointed as it‚Äôs such a clean pool and has huge changing rooms
showerReviews.author: naomi kerr

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awesome place for entertainment such as
1) swimming with a large pool and a small pool with a toddler pool/play area beside it. All equipped with lifeguards.
2) fully equipped gym.
3) fitness groups of many varieties. (IE: Zumba, stationary bikes for spin classes, bums and tums classes etc)
4) steam room and sauna.
5) large unisex changing room with lockable lockers, with family changing room and a disability changing room. All of the above have showers and toilets.
6) small cafe.
7) meeting/business rooms
8) play halls for (IE: netball/basketball, football, tennis, birthday parties, groups, etc)
9) large rock-climbing room.
10) friendly reception.
11) suitable for birthday parties, groups (IE: girl guides, boy scouts, youth clubs etc)
Overall a fantastic place for all kinds of experiences and entertainment.

locations.title: Everlast Gyms
locations.address: ÓÉàCrescent Link Retail Park, Crescent Link, Belfast BT47 5FR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This is just general for Everlast Gyms, quite expensive for what you get with terrible cancel policies. This one in particular has a very good gym that's clean, a great variety of equipment, modern and quite spacey to where it doesn't feel like your shoulder to shoulder. The pool, on the other hand, is mediocre. Most of the time, the pool is always occupied by swimming classes and other group activities, which makes the pool even smaller. They had jacuzzies but were removed due to the cost of running them despite being a decently busy gym. Staff are fine being mostly talking with each other in the reception area. I would give this a 3.5 star more to the fact their better gyms in the area for price but only use this gym if you want one with a pool as its the only one.
showerReviews.author: Thomas Burnett

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brutal. Tried to take my 2 kids swimming today. It was always a walk in and wait place but I checked the website and it said no need to book Monday to Friday but maybe during holidays.
So I tried booking in advance using the app and it wasn't responding.
Drove 30 minutes and queued only to be told it was fully booked.
Other people there had the same experience.
Website/app needs to be seriously improved.
Only word is a joke for what happened. And the staff lady was trying to say I must not be using the app properly so I took my phone out I'm front of her to prove it.
If I could give 0 stars I would.
Last time we tried to come 12 months ago it was closed for major refurbishments when we arrived. Literally nothing on their website to say that only some articles from online news sites.
showerReviews.author: Mark Cronin

showerReviews.reviewText: The swimming pool at Newry Leisure Centre has potential, but the experience felt overly controlled. Staff seem more focused on enforcing rules than on creating a relaxed, enjoyable atmosphere for family swims. The constant whistle blowing and shouting from the life guards was off-putting, and the slides, which are a big attraction, are rarely open. There‚Äôs a need for a better balance between safety and fun to make it a place families actually look forward to visiting.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I started with AD fitness over 3 weeks ago now. I‚Äôve done many different diets and went to different gyms. The main difference with AD is that you‚Äôre not on your own. When I was going to the gym myself I didn‚Äôt really know what I was doing  or what half the equipment was even for. I used the treadmill/ stair master and that‚Äôs about itüòÇ. This uncertainty and lack of support made it extremely easy to throw the towel in.  AD has had a positive impact on not only my physical health , but emotional wellbeing. locations.title: Bristol Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàOakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for ¬£3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.
showerReviews.author: Paul Bobo

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloyd‚Äôs and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ib√©rico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: Gastronom√≠a Europa

Steam room: my preferred hot one. It got pretty steamy in there, especially if you stand up. Sitting down was easy.

I had such a lovely spa day package including lunch yesterday.
So starting from the beginning:
Parking: is very limited depending what time you go. There‚Äôs a public Ringo paid for car park out the front which is where I ended up going but if you can get into their car park I think it‚Äôs free or cheaper.
The setting itself is quirky and buzzy and I loved it, the pool was a great temperature and the sauna was wonderful.
The jacuzzi was always busy and a little small and the steam room wasn‚Äôt very steamy and in need of an update. The cold bucket was fun after the sauna too.
I wish they provided some flip flops as I forgot mine (even if they‚Äôre paid for) and wish there was more comfortable seating around to read a book as this seemed limited but didn‚Äôt detract from my overall experience.
I also got very cold from being wet and sat outside before my massage and even after I showered I wish I‚Äôd brought an extra towel so I wasn‚Äôt sat back in a wet robe (didn‚Äôt think ahead).
I had a full body massage and the massage rooms sit above the edge of the pool. You can hear the indistinct chatter and clanging of cutlery but I actually found this to be really relaxing rather than it being so quiet with a bit of spa music. The massage was amazing and I came out feeling so relaxed and the masseuse took me to the tea room and offered a selection of herbal teas after and it helped warm me back up.
The lunch was unbelievable - service was good and quick and very tasty.
All in all - such an amazing value spa day and really well done - there‚Äôs a few minor things that could be done to make the experience 5* overall but you can‚Äôt knock it!
Thank you so much
showerReviews.author: Jordan Moore

showerReviews.reviewText: A wonderful day to celebrate my friend‚Äôs birthday. All the staff were welcoming, accommodating and exceptionally well trained. Thank you all so much, I will be back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a great experience and so well organised.
Loved that there were no kids in there when I arrived at 5.30pm.

One thing I didn‚Äôt realise was that it was a lap pool instead of just swimming/ chilling. It did get more relaxed towards the end.

They said it was 26 degrees but was freezing. You do eventually get used to the temperature. The hot tub was crowded and felt more like the temperature the pool should have been but was perfect on a warm day.

The food, drinks and service was impeccable. Can‚Äôt wait to come back again and try the rest of it. Seriously so, so good!
showerReviews.author: V MK

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros -

Really thoughtfully refurbished and brought back to life. Plenty of choice when it comes to packages, combo deals. I liked the eucalyptus scent in the steam room. It felt quite spacious, considering it was a Saturday lunchtime - pool area was split into fast lane, medium lane and ‚Äúchill and chat‚Äù lane. Sauna had a nice big window looking out onto the pool area, in fact generally speaking it felt quite light due to the big windows around the pool. 2 of us had neck, back, shoulder massage and facial (mine was by Michelle and my mum had Carole, who was also very good) and 1 of us had the exfoliator treatment, these were excellent and professional, felt super relaxed. Good quality herbal infusion made for us afterwards. I thought parking wasn‚Äôt bad value (¬£11 for the whole day paid on departure, although first 3 hours are free. Caution as there is a small car park directly in front of the Lido car park, which I believe is run by a different company). Dinner as part of the package was very good, better than we had been expecting, given some reviews. We paid extra for the steak, and had desserts. Staff explained procedures and timings / what to expect. Towel and robe provided for massage packages only (no footwear). Relaxed vibe - didn‚Äôt need to rush to get dressed post massage to enjoy our meal, we were able to eat whilst robed (I guess that could be off-putting for those only attending to eat).

Cons -

Overall online booking process I found quite long-winded. The main pool was much colder than we were expecting (great as a cold plunge after sauna though). Hot tub was quite small, and by far the most popular area. Didn‚Äôt find jacuzzi that others mention in reviews, was there a button to activate in the hot tub? Car park is quite small, so limited availability. Some of the staff in the restaurant were not the most warm or welcoming. Would be lovely to have some fresh juices on the menu. Relax area post-massage was quite small, imagine it wouldn‚Äôt be that relaxing on a busy day. No area to lounge out and read a book, but to be honest if you booked the ‚Äúswim, massage, meal‚Äù option I‚Äôm not sure where you‚Äôd find time to lounge as you‚Äôre so packed with activities and two hours pre-massage is just right to sample a little of all of the areas offered (sauna/steam/pool).
showerReviews.author: Alice G

locations.title: YMCA Childcare
locations.address: ÓÉà51 Glenshane Rd, Drumahoe, Londonderry BT47 3SF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have two girls aged 3 and 6 who have been attending YMCA for After School Care since September 2020. We both work full time as key workers and simply could not have continued this work without the support we received from YMCA, who collect our girls from school and provide them with a fun and caring environment until we pick them up after work - it's very flexible up until 6pm and even when I thought I was going to be late one day there was never any stress from the staff. Diane showed us through the centre when we started and it was reassuring for us that the in-house routines and hand hygiene would minimise risk during the pandemic. The pick-up/drop-off system done by calling on arrival is safe and works well.

There are various different rooms that are all set up for a wide variety of active play and lots of different creative activities. The hall area gives the bigger kids lots of space for games and running around. The outdoor playground is compact but has recently been refurbished with artificial grass and new slides/gym equipment and the girls tell us they have lots of fun when they can go outside. So far we have had no problems whatsoever - our girls come out with big smiles on their faces after having had so much fun and stimulation in a safe and creative environment. They bring home lots of pieces of art and craft that they've been working on, all of which complements well the work they're doing at school. I can't fault any of the staff - they all engage so well with the girls and genuinely seem to love kids and enjoy the work they do. We get plenty of updates each day on the ParentZone app which lets us see what they are getting up to.

I asked the girls to tell me what they like about YMCA:
6 yo "I love all the art that I can do there and there's lots of playing stuff that I like and good books. I like the Home Corner which is like a wee house with dressing-up stuff and a kitchen. The grown ups are always friendly and they like doing lots of art with the kids"
3 yo "I like the reading books and playing there. Playing the floor is lava is fun!"

I would highly recommend this service as a trusted, fun and nurturing place to care for your kids that also provides very good value. I can only assume that they also provide a great nursery for the under 3s as well, but hopefully some other reviews can comment on that. I congratulate the staff for all their hard work, especially for the vital support they've given us as parents during this difficult year.  Despite all the challenges our two have never been happier. Keep up the good work!
showerReviews.author: John White

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Swindon Truckstop
locations.address: ÓÉàSwindon truck stop Oxford road, Oxford Rd, Swindon SN3 4ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! Onroute Truckstops have been very busy at Swindon! What an amazing difference! My last visit to Swindon was shall we say, ‚Äòbelow expectations‚Äô; I really struggled to believe this was the same place.

On arrival the entrance was clean, clear and has obviously been attended to with the usual rubbish and debris cleared away. The security hut has had a complete refurb which was much needed. As a driver attending any truck stop if your first line of sight is dirt, rubbish and dilapidated buildings it immediately raises alarm bells as to what sort of site you‚Äôre visiting.  Signage to parking was clear and concise, and there was ample space available.  Traffic flow was moderate and free.

First engagement was the canteen, by which entry was via a newly developed entrance.  Stunning.  New groundwork‚Äôs was colourful and very pleasing to the eye.  There were new picnic tables positioned outside - and were being used.  New plants were positioned, giving the homely welcome.  A huge effort has been made to greet customers to this area and the transformation from the old side entrance is worlds apart.  There are new big screens displaying menus, new information points, leaflets, all safety measures present, serviceable, in date and correctly placed where applicable.

I met ‚ÄòClaire‚Äô behind the counter, who was welcoming, bright and bubbly and just what you need to lift your spirits from the drama and stress of the highways. Also in attendance were approximately 4 other staff and the whole food counter experience was top class.  A very nice touch was a bowl of free healthy fruit for visitors. Well done there.  Food service was very quick - top marks.

The canteen was spotless. There were plenty of customers throughout the day (I was there for a 24hr stop) and I watched with interest the positive energy this team had going on. Everyone was greeted with a welcome and a smile.  No name badges though, I‚Äôd like to have seen that - it‚Äôs a more personal presentation to thank someone and show appreciation by referring to them by name. It‚Äôs also awkward to have to ask, maybe this should be considered. On the opposite side of the coin it equally encourages staff to deliver excellence as it‚Äôs much easier to identify individual failings. Certainly not the case here today however.

No sooner had a diner finished a staff member was instantly on hand to clean and disinfect and prepare the space for the next customer.  There was also excellent promotion and encouragement by the staff to download and use the Onroute app.

Feedback: drivers are still struggling to find the SNAP terminals to pay for parking and are constantly having to queue and ask at the counter, disrupting staff from the catering flow.  The terminals hidden away in the toilet corridor and are not signed. A staff member had put a handwritten sign on the access door to highlight the location but was told by management to take it down. This was a poor decision and negatively impacted good staff initiative.  It may not have been ideal or as professional as a custom branded sign, but it was better than nothing!  There is still no clear signage to the SNAP payment terminals and needs addressed for full score achievement.

The shop was well stocked and inviting. It‚Äôs bright and has most of the essentials needed for drivers. As soon as I approached the shop a member of staff was there to assist if needed. I made several purchases and the whole experience again was very good.

The toilet corridor from the canteen leads to access snap terminals, ladies, gents and disabled toilets, and showers.  It was clean, fresh, clear of debris; and both snap terminals were fully functional. All fire safety measures were present, in date and clearly identified.  Health & Safety measures were also in place and being used effectively.

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt give any further details as I‚Äôve run out of characters! Happy to be contacted if necessary. Staff deserve special credit for a near perfect experience. Well done. Very well done.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText: It's been upgraded. Tepid soup was the order of the day and it just about made it out of the "cold " bracket. It's now a very small space in which the drivers eat compared to previously. Showers and toilets get the thumbs up though. I've eaten better food for less money. Next time I'll go to Sainsbury's next door and just buy something from there, it will be tastier than what I had. Do something about that soup, it's really bad, it was the vegetable soup and it was like someone just decided it would be best to use the old vegetables up by making a soup. The chef can't be happy, or doesn't have a tasting spoon. A dreary 1 star. Overall the old place was better for space. It feels cramped with 10 people in there
showerReviews.author: Mick Ward

showerReviews.reviewText:
üëç The Good
Secure parking ‚Äì that‚Äôs a big win, especially with today‚Äôs load theft
Well-marked bays ‚Äì no guesswork, no getting blocked in
Decent layout ‚Äì you can actually park without playing Tetris with a 44-tonner
On paper, it ticks the boxes.
üëé The Bad (the stuff that actually matters at 2am)
2 toilets for 100+ spaces
That‚Äôs not a truckstop ‚Äî that‚Äôs a queue simulator.
Cubicle size designed for jockeys
If you‚Äôre built like a proper driver and not a racing whippet, you‚Äôre fighting for elbow room just to sit down.
Only 2 showers
Again‚Ä¶ for 100 trucks ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Token-only showers
And here‚Äôs the killer:
How do you buy a token when nobody‚Äôs around?
Answer: you don‚Äôt.
So you‚Äôre:
tired
parked up legally
doing the right thing
and still can‚Äôt wash or take a dump in peace
That‚Äôs when a place officially fails as a driver facility.
