locations.title: City centre budget rooms - free wifi &a parking.
locations.address: ÓÉà11 Abercorn Rd, Londonderry BT48 6SA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First: the location on the map was wrong. We spent some time searching for the place in the rain until we asked at a convenience store and they helped us find it.

Second: When we arrived, it was dark. We knocked on the door, but no one came out, even though we had sent our arrival time. Since no one came out, we called the contact number, and the woman gave me directions to get a key that was inside a key box. I couldn't get it out. So she asked a friend who lived inside the house to let me in, and he then showed me how to get the key so I could leave later.

Third: Our room was on the first floor and was clearly completely different from what the photos show. The room had spiders, was dirty, we found hair on the sheets, the pillow had dust stains, and the bedspread was stained. The mattress was terrible. The door only worked with a key, which was very awkward to open.

Fourth: The bathroom was dirty. The shower worked.

Fifth: The cell phone signal inside is very poor, so I asked for the Wi-Fi password via text message (the woman said she'd send it to me via WhatsApp, but she never did). She responded by simply typing the password, so I texted her again to ask for her name, and she responded about two hours later, with no kindness.

When we arrived, we couldn't believe it. It's unfortunate that they offer such poor service, because the person isn't even friendly or there to greet you.

I wouldn't recommend it at all!
showerReviews.author: Patricia Latorre

locations.title: Jazz House
locations.address: ÓÉà13 Lawrence Hill, Londonderry BT48 7NJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We had an incredible stay at the jazz house. Booked really last minute on the day and everyone was so helpful and accommodating. The room, kitchen, lounge area are all so beautiful, felt very special with lots of quirky touches. Nice to have an outdoor space too. Bed very comfortableabd great shower. Having a kitchen to use with fridge, oven and microwave was brilliant. Nice coffee and milk provided  an excellent touch. Location was great, walking distance to centre of town but in a nice, quiet area. Free, on-street parking outside is great if you have a car. Would absolutely stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Gary Neville

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at the jazz house and found it to be quite a unique gem. The style and decor throughout the hotel were tastefully done, with plenty of charming details that made it stand out from other places we've stayed in Ireland, even those with (way) higher price tags. From the artwork on the walls to the vintage pieces scattered around, the hotel exudes character and charm.

We were impressed by the friendly communication before our arrival and the warm welcome we received upon check-in. The staff were lovely and made us feel right at home.

One of the highlights for us was the shared kitchen facilities, which were well-equipped with everything we needed, including an oven, dishwasher, and coffee machine. It was convenient to have a space to store snacks and prepare simple meals, especially for day trips. The communal lounge area was also a nice touch, providing a cozy spot to relax and unwind. None of these things changed the vibe, which was much closer to a hotel than e.g. a room in a shared airbnb house.

The shower facilities were modern and clean, adding to the overall comfort of our stay.

The hotel's location couldn't be better, just a short walk from the city center with plenty of shops nearby. And the fact that street parking was free was a definite bonus.

Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It offered a comfortable and convenient base for exploring the city, with friendly staff and unique touches that made it feel like a home away from home. :-)
showerReviews.author: Alex S.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hi folks,if you considering coming to Derry,consider this gem to indulge yourself in.We were a group of 9,and genuinely we were awestruck when we saw the interior.Attention to detail on every aspect of the experience.I personally love music and I LOVED the references and overall music vibe to the house.Fresh flowers were on point,but for me it was the bedrooms,all of them were spotless and whilst I didn't have an ensuite,the main bathroom was stunning with a huge claw foot bath and a hangover reducing shower.
There was tea/coffee making facilities in the ensuites but the kitchen had all you needed.
Everything was just a little visual treat.
We ordered breakfast from the Sister hotel a couple of doors down,and it saved us the hassle of cooking.

I haven't shut up about the place and have been recommending it to everyone.

Word to the wise...the Jazz House whilst a brisk 10 min walk into the action it is based on a steep hill,so bring your flats for the incline on the walk home.

Would like to commend the House Management for their attention to detail and how clean the house felt,no mean feat after a squad of women leave so BRAVO.

GET IT BOOKED..you won't regret I.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Fitzsimons

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed one night as a touring cyclist with a small tent. Simple, super-quiet campsite at the foot of a beautiful hill. I paid ¬£10. Pitches are flat with short, well-kept grass‚Äîideal for tents. There‚Äôs a small indoor shelter/room you can use and an outdoor washing-up area. Separate men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs toilets, each with a pleasant hot shower. No power sockets inside the shelter, but there‚Äôs a water tap outside. I slept very well and felt safe. locations.address: ÓÉà26 Benone Ave, Limavady BT49 0LQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Three of us stayed in a tent at the end of August in beautiful weather!
There is a separate tenting field at the front of the site. The field was nicely cut and the grass obviously well looked after, and arriving on a week day we had the pick of a 'site'. Sites weren't actually marked out, so if busy.....? Being in a tent, I wasn't allowed the option of an electric hook up for 'safety reasons', so had no extra facilities! We were charged ¬£30 per night for a patch of grass with access to a 'portacabin' toilet and coin operated shower which was temperamental and not always clean (on top of the pitch rental).
We're totally used to paying those kind of rates for a serviced site for a motorhome, but for an unserviced patch of grass, I feel is a rip-off! We enjoyed our time there, but that was due to the spectacular weather and definitely not the site!
We don't need to worry about this review's reception as we'll never be back!
showerReviews.author: Gavin Mason

showerReviews.reviewText:
Huge site with mainly static caravans, but there are still over 100 excellent, level, concrete pitches for touring vans. All have electricity and most have also a tap and a drain for grey water. Touring pitches are large and offset, so nobody is looking directly into the van in front or behind. The site is well kept, and the facilities block is kept clean and tidy. You get a key to access the toilets and showers for which you pay a ¬£2 refundable deposit.  In the ladies, there were approx 6 toilets, and I think 4 showers. You have to pay 20p for a shower, which would have been helpful to know when we checked in as it's a long walk to reception if you don't happen to have 20p.  Same to use the hairdryer. As far as we could see, there is only 1 area where rubbish can be left so, if you're in a touring van it's an awfully long walk.  There is a playground for children and large grassy areas for games. It's an ideal place for families.  There is also a gate that will lead you over the sand dunes onto Benone beach which is absolutely beautiful.
We are a retired couple so found the campsite a little crowded for our tastes. A little more information on check-in, such as a site map, would be helpful.
showerReviews.author: Anna Kavanagh

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved here. Just had our tent with us as all other forms of staying had been booked but we had fun. The whole site is clean, loads of amenities. Toilets, shower and changing rooms, sheltered area to sit and eat. Games tables, park, on site shop... They had orienteering that was on site and for ¬£1 it turned out to be loads of fun with the children.. Then off course you can book to take park on their climbing wall, zip line, archery etc. Each day has different activities to choose from. This time of year offered the maize maze which was loads of fun but with our weather it was very muddy lol.. Still made for great memories.. Views are outstanding. I'd definitely return and book a pod or bell tent and stay longer to take part in more. They fact that it's a families only place makes you feel more comfortable and safe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here August 2025 in a 6 man tent as a family of 4.

Pros.
Lovely rural setting.
Horses, hens, peacock, ducks etc all around (perfect for animal loving kids).
Use of communal fridge and microwave FOC.
Good location as a base for exploring the North Coast

Cons.
Cleanliness of the facilities!! Toilet, shower blocks and kichen area are very very basic and not particularly clean at all. Now this is an active farm and livery yard and we expected this to be fairly rough and ready but we saw no signs of cleaning at all during 3 day stay.  Wouldn't rush back on the basis of this alone.
Single wash hand basin for 2x mens showers and 2x mens toilets, made for a busy am and pm teeth brushing routine!
Road noise.  Unfortunately the main road into Portrush is very close by and was busy throughout the night.
Location, a car is a must especially for familes, too far to comfortably walk to Portrush town centre with kids.
showerReviews.author: Nadine Greer

showerReviews.reviewText: Great caravan site. Many static caravans but with touring pitches available. Toilets & washing facilities available & spotless. Self service laundry room available. Small play park for kids. Dog friendly, but must be on leads & cleaned up after. Peaceful rural situation, stunning sunsets (weather permitting). Out of town & a rural setting. Bridal path walk close by. Tesco shop, garage, good chip shop & off licence are all within 5 minutes drive. Portstewart strand no more than 10 minutes drive away, 20-30 min walk. Very well run & maintained site. Owner & staff are all very friendly.
showerReviews.author: Ian Hutchinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for one night here and unfortunately I didn‚Äôt think it was outstanding as previously rated. The bathrooms are dated and although they do the job, there‚Äôs no heating or dry area to step onto after having a shower. The floors needed a good clean. The camp ground for campers/caravans is an open paddock with a circular layout. There is no privacy and could do with some hedging or partitions.
All sites had power and outlets for grey and chemical toilet which was a bonus.
Wifi is extra and you need to sign up to a plan so we didn‚Äôt use it.
The playground has a slide, swings and two rockers with soft play surface which was fine for the kids.
I couldn‚Äôt find the door for the playroom (it wasn‚Äôt sign posted). I did meet one of the owners and she was very friendly and attentive when my shower flooded with a blocked drain.
I think it‚Äôs only fair to rate this park as OK 3/5 based on all of the other parks I have stayed in. It wasn‚Äôt outstanding From my experience.
showerReviews.author: Carolyn Ormsby

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time at the Leisureplex in around 8 years, and still lots of fun. Youngest daughter loved all of the slides, aside from getting stuck in one and being unceremoniously dumped out of her tube - no harm done (other than pride hurt) and she had a blast.

Plenty of changing rooms and the family changing rooms, although a tad small for a family of 4 (or more), were clean and adequate.

Slides, water park area for the young ones, jacuzzi, seated bubble area, and of course, the flowing river. Great time had effortlessly floating around and around!

Dining at Sinnamon Coffee - staff were very friendly and the dining/seating area was clean, food was tasty, freshly made and hot!

Great way to keep the children entertained for a couple of hours.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Callaghan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Club 24 Fitness Lisburn is a fantastic place to train. The staff are always friendly, greet you when you arrive, and say goodbye when you leave. They‚Äôre always available and happy to help.

The gym is super clean, with modern, well-maintained equipment. There‚Äôs a vending machine stocked with water and protein drinks, and loads of lockers for storage. The showers are spotless, with hot water, hairdryers, and straighteners provided ‚Äî a great bonus!

I also train with Janine, a personal trainer there, three mornings a week. She keeps the sessions fun, challenging, and helps a lot with food and nutrition advice.

Highly recommend this gym to anyone in the Lisburn area

locations.title: Hillingdon Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàGatting Way, Uxbridge UB8 1ES, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
In the summer for public swimming - Place perfect for loud and wild children, and for not well behaved adults, who don't know what the fitness swimming lanes are for and like to just chill there to make swimmers annoyed... Great for people who like to swim in dirty water and who don't mind not being able to shower themselves after the session due to very low water pressure. Place totally overcrowded in hot weather, not enough spaces at the car park... I didn't expect it will look like this on Monday evening, so I totally don't recommend visit in the summer for 'swim for fitness' session.
Place is good for closed swimming events out of season (that is why I gave 2 stars not 1)
showerReviews.author: Agata Cwiertnia

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is will be hopefully read by management. This is the only outdoor swimming pool I hillingdon and should be managed differently. Why on hot summer days, especially weekends, half the pool is assigned for fitness, even the shallow part of it. We have been there today, temperature is 30c, and there are like 10 fitness swimmers, reserving the whole left side, and around 200 others all crowded in the other shallow corner of the pool. People kept trying to swim in the clearly less used area and life guards kept telling everyone off and asking them to leave the fitness side. There was one fast lane which was used by literally 2 swimmers. Clearly the priority in such days should be for people to have fun, and those "Olympic" swimmers could book the fast lane or book the indoor pool. You should needed to be there and see how stupid the management was.
This needs to be rearranged as this summer is clearly warm and people deserve to have fun.
showerReviews.author: Jas (Jazz)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spent the day here on Sunday- a very hot day. Unsurprisingly it was crowded with not enough sunloungers for the number of people- we had to spread our towels on bare concrete. Just too crowded in general, I think numbers should be controlled a bit more- lifeguards were trying their best to manage behaviour but it was hard.
Other than that I actually enjoyed swimming here and didn't think the conditions were too bad- of course there were insects and leaves in an outdoor pool, that's what you get! Would return, but I'd try and avoid the peak days/times I think.
showerReviews.author: Anita Reddy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took myself and my daughter here today. We were booked on for the 2pm-5pm session for the outdoor Lido. We arrived 10mins early and only a small que was lined up ready to go in. Lifeguard came to the gate about 5mins before 2pm to hand over wristbands and started to let people in. Lots of sunloungers and changing rooms available. Only downside was there was 4 umberellas, 3 of them were at tables instead of sunlongers. So was exposed to sun all day. Bring plenty of suncream!
There was a cute chips and snack van on poolside, which offered hot food and cold food, drinks, ice creams etc. Reasonable price, we brought plain chips (¬£2.90). The pool was very spacious but was freezing cold. Although it said on the website heated pool, it definitely wasn't. Overall a great day out with my daughter and will be coming back again this summer.
showerReviews.author: Hannah Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took myself and my daughter here today. We were booked on for the 2pm-5pm session for the outdoor Lido. We arrived 10mins early and only a small que was lined up ready to go in. Lifeguard came to the gate about 5mins before 2pm to hand over wristbands and started to let people in. Lots of sunloungers and changing rooms available. Only downside was there was 4 umberellas, 3 of them were at tables instead of sunlongers. So was exposed to sun all day. Bring plenty of suncream!
There was a cute chips and snack van on poolside, which offered hot food and cold food, drinks, ice creams etc. Reasonable price, we brought plain chips (¬£2.90). The pool was very spacious but was freezing cold. Although it said on the website heated pool, it definitely wasn't. Overall a great day out with my daughter and will be coming back again this summer.
showerReviews.author: Hannah Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText: My poor primary aged son literally got a UTI whilst swimming here. SO overcrowded and dirty. Clearly they have no idea how to maintain the correct chlorine levels. SORT IT OUT! Such a shame as this is the only outdoor swimming pool for miles

locations.title: Soul Sauna Lisburn
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Bridge St, Lisburn BT28 1XY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friend and I headed down today and we were really impressed.
Neither of us had ever done an infrared sauna before, and were pleasantly surprised with how hot it felt without needing to be as warm as a normal sauna - and you don‚Äôt get that awful stuffiness when taking deep breaths!
The facilities were really well kitted out - felt like a very calming, nice environment. There is a plunge pool in both male and female changing room for a bit of added privacy and Ryan very kindly provides water and electrolytes for you which is a lovely touch. Showers have body wash which smells nice !

Beautiful spot for a recharge and lovely to be greeted by such a friendly face :)

Will definitely be back. Thank you Ryan!
showerReviews.author: Bonnie MacRae

showerReviews.reviewText: If I could rate a 0 I would, this is the worst ‚Äòspa‚Äô I‚Äôve ever been to if you would even call it a spa. Floors were flooded with dirty water in the changing rooms and the robes were damp and smelled rotten. Went out to hot tub dirty glasses leftovers on plates , didn‚Äôt even get in the hot tub it was stinking, and our cocktails were literally dilute with no water disgusting and nothing like the photos on their Facebook pageü§£ sent up to the quiet room where we were met with more dirty plates and cups with popcorn and bun crumbs everywhere, after the massages we were to get a fruit pladder which looks amazing on their Facebook and tea and coffee, we were brought a tiny bowl half filled with soggy fruit ü§£ we just up and walked out at that point, they then offered two free back massages and I declined straight away and said how much are they where I was told 49 each , I said I‚Äôd prefer the money and they fully agreed , only to see today they‚Äôve sent me ¬£50, and are now saying their massages are ¬£25ü§£ü§£ü§£ Do not go here
showerReviews.author: Ellie Currie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really unique spa. I was visiting from Liverpool and was made up when my cousin booked us in here for the day.
Unfortunately, when we arrived there was torrential rain, so once checked in we were invited to the relaxation suite were we had our fruit platter and first cocktail. The fruit platter was really fresh and well presented and the cocktail was really tasty. The relaxation suite was lovely and calm.
We then headed down to the changing room to change into our robes (provided by the spa) and from there, we entered the hottub, which was luckily undercover as it was still drizzling. The hottub was really warm and relaxing. We were promised another cocktail once we got in the hottub, but unfortunately this never happened. I understand that the staff members were probably very busy and forgot and we didn't mention anything either.
When we got our of the hot tub and changed, I could hear a staff member on the front desk telephoning a previous customer to address and resolve a complaint. Whilst the staff member dealt with the customer compassionately, I felt it was quite unprofessional to be able to hear such a private conversation, especially when the conversation is about a complaint towards a spa. This didn't really impact our visit, but more just feedback for the staff.
After the hottub, we had our massages. I had a 45 minute back massage with Megan. It was super relaxing and didn't feel rushed at all. Megan's technique was great. I felt like I was floating when I walked out. I couldn't keep my eyes open on the train back and was absolutely exhausted for the rest of the evening - this is a testament to Megan's skill!
Thank you for a lovely day
showerReviews.author: Nat Barlow

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have updated and edited this review and added star's. This is because I appreciated the staff trying to help and going out of their way to make sure I was happy with their service. I do not delete reviews as they are honest but I will edit them if warranted and this was.
Went to store and then to the clearance section at the back. The staff were helpful when in store, unfortunately there was a manufacturing fault with my shower doors, I would strongly recommend opening very box when you receive it immediately. You may not know what you are looking at but you may see faults or defects.
Jordan did his best to help.
I was asked for a review via email, decided I would not make a rash review on the day. 4 days lately went to reply to email review to find it was timed out!! Not exactly helpful.
The store has helped resolved some issues so the star rating has been edited.
showerReviews.author: Nicola Montgomery-Shields

showerReviews.reviewText: We order shower doors in Nov. they didnt arrive to February which isnt to bad due to Christmas. However when they arrived they where just too small. Needed next size up. We exchanged, wait until April for delivery, but they only exchanged 1 panel and not the door. We then had to reorder the door. Its the 1st May and the door has arrived way too big. Talking 200mm bigger than ordered.  After emails confirming the correct size.  I have no idea how long it will be until we can final use our ensuite.  Very very unhappy with the service. And no idea when we will recieve the shower door we need
showerReviews.author: Nathan Jennings

locations.title: A&C Performance Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 37, Enterprise Organisation, 6 Enterprise Cres, Lisburn BT28 2EH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good no-nonsense gym. Mostly free weights, Smith Machines. No mirrors, no posers no hiding places!!

The gym size suits 1:1's, small groups and people who dont like large venues, which can be intimidating. Parking is good. No showers but toilets on site. Ground floor and good accessibility.

My P.T., Connla, offers tailor-made programmes for all client-types. He is endlessly optimistic and in always in good mood without being OTT. He is experienced, patient, a great talker but a good listener too. Connla has recently been successful in national bodybuilding competition; his dedication is inspiring.

The guys are in the early stages of building a great community & business. Their client-base has a mixture of various needs/goals. And i would recommend to any  cluents of any age/experience.

About reviewer: I have been a member for 12 months +. I train, on site, twice a week. Age 57, male. Experience: low.  Goal: build muscle/tone.
showerReviews.author: peter gallagher

locations.title: Railway Sleeper Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà15 Sea Rd, Castlerock, Coleraine BT51 4TL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely loved my stay! The hostel is in a perfect location‚Äîjust a short walk to Castle Rock Beach, which is beautiful.

The service was outstanding.
The rooms are warm and well-heated, with super comfy beds and spacious layouts. The showers are fantastic‚Äîhot and powerful, perfect after a day of exploring.

The communal area is great for relaxing and meeting fellow travelers, and the kitchen is well equipped .

Overall, a cozy, well-maintained hostel with excellent facilities and an unbeatable location. Highly recommend!

This is also a great cafe in walking distance called The Surf Shack check them out !
showerReviews.author: James Andrews

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great stay at the Railway Sleeper Hostel.  Seamless check in and absolutely great friendly staff. Grant and Luke were over the top on being welcome to the hostel and super friendly.  Beautiful hostel and super clean.  Super comfy beds and very well done.   Hit showers and big open spacious bathrooms! Place is located in the best location. Right off the train station making travel to castle rock super convienant. Central to all the attractions. 21min drive to Dark Hedges and 25min to Giants Causeway and Dunluce castle. Super close to Mussenden Temple and the beaches!   Luke had a great recommendation to hit the Dark Hedges just before sunrise. Had it all to myself for two hours! Beautiful photos for a photographer.
Highly recommend staying here!!

locations.title: Paddy's Palace
locations.address: ÓÉà68 Lisburn Rd, Belfast BT9 6AF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was tiny, which was OK but the walls had holes in them, the window was full of dust and what looked like dirt. There was also a mysterious big stain of something running down the wall, and it looked like No one had cleaned the sink in ages. The lock on the door was very loose and it looked like one good kick would get the door open. The beds was OK, softer than expected and the sheets was clean. I came with a group of people and I got lucky with my room as the others got rooms with thick layers of dust, broken windows and creaky beds.

When we got there, one of the toilets on our floor was clogged, and later that evening the other toilet got clogged. We left early the next morning and when we came back later in the evening, both of the toilets was still clogged. We left that same evening because we booked for another hotel on the first day because we just couldn't be there. The bathrooms looked and smelled dirty, there was piss on the floor around one of the toilets, and I didn't even check the showers because I didn't want to know how it was there. Do not recommend this place.
showerReviews.author: Emtoohs

showerReviews.reviewText:
You get what you pay for. The staff was extremely unprofessional. Nice people, but very unprofessional. The bathrooms were very unreliable. There was almost never toilet paper and sometimes the sinks wouldn't turn on and the shower doors failed
to shut completely. One of the people I was staying with found the toilet paper in a closet and took it upon herself to re-stock all of the bathrooms. Overall I found that the upkeep of this place is an extreme oversight and the staff seemed to rather hang out with each other than to take care of the hostel they were running. Also the establishment seemed a bit sketchy. They only take cash and they don't  give out receipts. In all honesty we could've left without paying because they had no record of us being there.
Again the staff was very nice, even the people staying at the hostel were nice. But the hostel Itself really needs some attention.
You get what you pay for I guess
showerReviews.author: Gabe Metz

showerReviews.reviewText: This is certainly the worst place I have ever stayed in, really wondering how any authority allows such a dump to host guests. There is mound on the walls, no fire detectors in the room, no lockers for personal belongings, the entire place smells of old sweat and weed. Staff are inattentive and couldn‚Äôt care less about anything, it‚Äôs an appalling place that is really just a minor step up from sleeping in a train station. If you can sleep anywhere else do that, it can‚Äôt get worse than this hole.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed in a four bed room with little space. I wouldn‚Äôt describe the beds as comfortable but they did the job for one night. Was initially cold but heating came on come time for bed and was on in the morning.

The bathroom was nice, not spotless but certainly tolerable.The shower worked well and water was sufficiently hot.

The kitchen was pretty run down, with dirty dishes, spiders and broken mugs but the living room was surprisingly pleasant with a television, pc and a nice selection of games.

The main setback for our stay was that the lock to our door got jammed when we closed it for the night. When one of us needed to go to the bathroom in the night we couldn‚Äôt get out.
In the morning we had one of our friends that was staying in a different room come help us. We passed the key under the door and they opened it from the outside. I must add,
we tried calling the reception 4 times and got no answer.
If this happened to someone that was staying on their own I don‚Äôt know how they‚Äôd get out.
If a fire was to break out in the night we would have been trapped inside...

In conclusion, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hostel to someone who hasn‚Äôt stayed in one before because it‚Äôs definitely low tier however if you don‚Äôt have many options it‚Äôll probably be okay... just be damn sure your lock is working.
showerReviews.author: Conor MG

In conclusion, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hostel to someone who hasn‚Äôt stayed in one before because it‚Äôs definitely low tier however if you don‚Äôt have many options it‚Äôll probably be okay... just be damn sure your lock is working.
showerReviews.author: Conor MG

showerReviews.reviewText: Do not stay here! Extremely run dun with no modern facilities. Bathrooms are very dirty and an empty 6 pack of beer found in the room from hopefully the last guest. We were the only people staying as it was part of our tour which says a lot. One plug in the dorm room to share and no lockers or individual lights. Had to bang on the front door to be let in as intercom was apparently not working.
showerReviews.author: Mark Powell

showerReviews.reviewText:
I decided to give two stars because the overall experience is rather poor. That being said having talked to other people that have stayed in other Belfast hostels this one does not seem quite so bad.

Would I reccomend this place over other Belfast hostels, yes. Would I generally reccomend it, no. If you have a little more money you might want to actually consider a hotel for Belfast (and this is coming from an avid hostel traveller)

Linen is A+, but that is about the only thing that is positive

The kitchen is only open from 9am to 8pm which frankly means you will be eating out a lot. The garden also was not open during my stay and it could only have been accessed via the kitchen meaning it's subject to the same opening hours. No facilities can be accessed outside of those hours (can't get something out of the fridge, can't make tea...)

Depending on who is working the common area might be open for a little bit longer, but not after 9pm.

This means that there is quite a lot of time that you can only spend in your room which is quite boring for a trip.

Even for a hostel this place is on the dirtier side. Especially the bathrooms/showers have mold growing on the ceiling.

Staff can be hit or miss (but they are all friendly, some of them are just clueless-ish).

Online they advertised that you could book a giant's causeway tour via them which during my stay was not the case, so I just booked one on the Internet myself.

As of August 2023 it was only possible to pay in cash.

The door in my dorm room (room 11) gave me some concerns since according to it's labelling its a fire door but has a 3cm gap to the floor. Generally the place has seen better days.

I liked the crowd, very international, generally very fun.
showerReviews.author: Yvonne Zimmer

showerReviews.reviewText:
It has beds and showers and that's about all I can say that's good...
The "breakfast," while supposed to be cereal and toast with the usual jams, butter, etc, was made with all the very cheapest of things and half of the condiments were empty just 15 minutes after breakfast started (at 8am). Even the instant coffee tastes like someone cooked hotdogs in it and the "wash your own dishes" rule was not enforced and no one cleaned up after, so there where dirty dishes in the "clean" area.
My bed sheets had a blood stain on them that looked like it hadn't even been washed and there weren't even lockers in the rooms for valuables.
The staff were vaguely polite but not particularly welcoming either.
In short, one of the worst hostels I've stayed at so far.

locations.title: Castlewellan Forest Park
locations.address: ÓÉàForest Park View, Castlewellan BT31 9BU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at the campsite here for one night and really enjoyed it. It's a well kept site with good toilet and shower facilities although the toilets were a little bit of a distance from our pitch. The setting is fantastic with lovely scenery, nice forest walks and a large lake with a big castle on the hill overlooking the lake. From the campsite it's a short 10 min walk into the town where you have a supermarket, pubs, food outlets, coffe shops etc. We will be back for a longer stay in the near future and will probably bring bicycles and kayaks to make more use of the facilities here. There's a maze and play area's for kids to enjoy and plenty of space to run around.
Definitely worth a visit.
showerReviews.author: Kieran Faughey

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had the most incredible camping experience at Castlewellan Forest Park Campsite, and I can't recommend it enough! From the moment we arrived, we were blown away by how well-maintained the entire park is. The grounds are pristine, with clean and spacious camping areas, and the amenities are nothing short of exceptional. The bathrooms and showers were spotless and cleaned to an unbelievable standard, with staff routinely checking to ensure everything was in perfect condition.

What made our stay even more special was the kindness and helpfulness of the park rangers. Every single one we met was friendly, welcoming, and eager to assist with any questions we had. On the morning of our departure, my partner had a lovely conversation with one of the female rangers, who was so kind and attentive. She even took on board our suggestion about installing hot ash bins around the campground‚Äîa true sign of how much they care about their guests‚Äô feedback.

And the scenery? Absolutely stunning! The peaceful forest setting, combined with views of the beautiful lake and surrounding mountains, made this one of the most picturesque campsites we‚Äôve ever visited. Whether you're a seasoned camper or new to outdoor adventures, Castlewellan Forest Park is an absolute must-visit. Five stars all the way!
showerReviews.author: Jason ‚ÄúJD‚Äù Seawright

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great area for camping, numbers are always capped so plenty of space to pitch. Great toilet & shower blocks and an area for washing dishes (tho no power points). Smaller block by reception also has launderette facilities and a cafe..

Tennis courts, mountain trails including a Narnia Trail to fuel young imaginations. Good sized playpark and an small outdoor gym. Loads of green areas for ball games and beside a stream and a Fairy Glen. 10 minute walk into Rostrevor village for supplies. If eating out try the Thai green curry in The Church Bistro (closes at 5pm weekdays so be early)

Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: michael mcconville

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely spacious hardstand touring pitches with plenty of grass area for campervans, motorhomes and caravans all fully serviced with electricity and water. Also great tent pitches. Shower block is clean with plenty of hot water. Utility area great for dish washing. No laundry facilities. The location is absolutely amazing with plenty of walking, hiking and cycling. A parkrun takes place here every Saturday morning. Town centre is only 5mins walk with plenty of bars and restaurants and grocery stores. There is also a really good cafe onsite which is great for breakfast and lunch if you don't feel like cooking.  If I had to give a negative, the only thing I would say is that it would be nice not to have to pay for electricity on the hard standings if it's not required. Surely it can be turned off for individual pitches ü§î. That being said, I have already booked to go back and have still awarded 5 stars.
showerReviews.author: beverley martin

locations.title: Bloody Bridge Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉà35 Ballagh Rd, Newcastle BT33 0LA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a wild camper I always did tend to avoid camp sites as a preference. However I (we, fellow wild camping mates) have fallen in love with this place!
It is a perfect pitch with fantastic views of the Sea no matter where you pitch. The site is layered back up from the the foot of the mountain for maximum views and accessibility.
The site is well protected, gated and security around the clock. It is very safe and well managed. It's the perfect base as well for those of you who like to venture - Swimming in the Sea, swimming in the lakes or rock pools, hiking among the Mourne mountains.
This place is so near perfect I have been twice in recent weeks and looking to go again before the end of the month, availability dependent.
The nearby town of Newcastle, Co Down is also a great spot for strolling, shopping and even a couple of pints listening to live music if you fancy a night out.
showerReviews.author: Jason Cauldwell

We have just spent two nights at Millstone and it was really lovely.
We were the only ones on site, due to it being midweek, the facilities were great, the toilet block houses three toilets, two with showers, there is a third shower room at the back of the block with a separate entrance. All were a great size and very clean. There is an outside kitchen area to do your washing up, it‚Äôs surrounded by Aloe Vera so had a very tropical feel about it. The view is beautiful! The campsite is terraced so everyone is able to see the stunning vista. Caroline and Des were wonderful hosts, easily contactable before hand and if we had any questions while we were there. Its location to Newcastle and the surrounding areas is fantastic. Highly recommend, we will be back.
showerReviews.author: Katie Noon

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friends and I had a super time at Bloody Bridge Campsite. We cmaped in tents and we also had a camper van. The location is fantastic, a 5 min drive from Newcastle town, and 10 mins from both Tollymore Forest Park and Castlewellan park. Just 2 mins up the road is a spot to do some rock pool swimming (recommended by Caroline our host). Caroline and Desy were so welcoming and lovely. They were there if we needed them , which we didn't as everything that we needed was there. Clean toilet facilities, plenty of power sockets and some picnic benches to have your morning coffee and snacks.

The views from the campsite are stunning and because all the campers are nestled in amongst the trees it didn't feel like you were on top of your neighbour.

Good value for money too at ¬£30 per night for a 4-man tent. Would highly recommend this campsite in an absolutely beautiful area near the Mourne Mountains. :-)

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a fantastic time here in our touring caravan.  Clean toilets and warm showers. Play park for the kids. We actually stayed an extra night. Will definitely be back again.
showerReviews.author: Ian McFetridge

showerReviews.author: Ian McFetridge

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site is well maintained and seems well suited for static caravans. The toilets were cleaned daily though we never saw the cleaner.

Speaking as well seasoned campers, we think that the site needs major improvements that may not cost them the earth. 1) hot washing up water, the water was tepid at best, and cold most evenings. 2) warm showers, showers were ok in the morning and cold at other times. 3) soap and dryers in the toilets, there was none. 4) urinals fitted in the gents, there were none which meant that the seats for the two toilets were often dirty. 5) local knowledge, the one thing we were told was the location of local chippy yet it was closed when we drove out to it. 6) the tent field was liable to being waterlogged as it took the water from the ajoining feild. 7) litter picked up, previous campers left a mess, we left it there for 4 days untill we picked it up ourselves. 8) more laundrette keys, there was only one which entalled a lengthy walk just to return the key and then to repeat it when it was finish. I could say more, but this will do for now. Consultanacy fee is in the post!
showerReviews.author: Derek Sewell

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at Causeway Coast Caravan Park using a caravan owned by a family member, and overall, it was a delightful experience. The park‚Äôs location is superb‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâjust a short stroll from the town, making it incredibly convenient for grabbing groceries, dining out, or exploring local attractions.

The facilities on-site are well-suited for families. Our kids had a blast in the swimming pool and arcades, which provided hours of entertainment no matter the weather. The atmosphere felt warm and community-driven, with many families clearly enjoying their time there.

The only reason we‚Äôve rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the steadily increasing site fees. Even as guests using a family member‚Äôs caravan, we were aware of how much more expensive it‚Äôs become year after year. While the quality of the park is strong, the rising costs may deter long-term visitors or repeat guests.

In short: if you're looking for a convenient, family-oriented park with good facilities, Causeway Coast Caravan Park is a great choice‚Äîjust be mindful of the growing site fees.
showerReviews.author: Mark Young

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really enjoyed my stay... Very helpful and friendly. Lovely beach and only short walk.
Toilet and shower block was really clean... My only grip was the showers themselves were full of sand on the base, I would have thought if you use the shower you should make sure you leave it clean for others, had to wear flip flops, and no plug socket for hairdryer. But I will be back....
